item.title: React App with RedHat SSO or keycloak
item.description: In this post, I will show you how to secure a React app using RedHat SSO (upstream keycloak). In this case, openid-connect is my identity provider. sso_setup Install the official keycloak js adapter npm i keycloak-js --save Setup the client with the host and port; in my case it’s localhost:9000 sso_setup In App.js add in a JavaScript object with the required configuration; you will find these configurations under Clients->Installation
